column5: if anyone has this York 3230 home gym and know what the problem with the butterfly press? the problem is the weights dont start to lift, or any resistence till about 3/4s of the motion, whats wrong? its like the cable may be too long, but if we tighent it then the middle part that holds the weights are lifted, can any toss a bone?
It's not a good system.  Trade it in for a $2000 Parabody.  This coming from Hercules.  Not me.
There should have been a set of shorter cables included for the butterfly press. At least there was with mine.
yeah ive heard, do u know how i can get a shorter cable or shorten it myself?  and how bout  the maxium resistence cable, how do u adjust that, says its max can be 160lbs or so
free weights are the way to go.been hittin them since winter and have packed on 20plus lbs of muscle.

I changed all the cables.  I used 1/16'' coated cables instead of the 1/8'' that came with the system.  The 1/16'' is much more flexible and it now works really well.  At first I didn't like it at all and I've noticed that the guy who sold it to me didn't install it properly. By the way, adjusting the cables is very easy.  Just use a 1/8'' sleeve (me it is 3/32'') and make a loop with the cable.  I also thin that it is possible to add weight to it even if they say that we can't.  I will try it if i can find other weights.
trade it for a bench, squat rack, barbell and some weights and dont worry about flyes.  i know that doesnt help but its my best advice.
does it help you catch more fish?
